definitions.example: When he struck it with a hammer, there was a loud bang.

definitions.definition: A strike upon an object causing such a noise.
The symbol !, known as an exclamation point.
definitions.example: An e-mail address with an ! is called a bang path.

definitions.definition: A factorial, in mathematics, because the factorial of n is often written as n!
An offbeat figure typical of reggae songs and played on guitar and piano.

definitions.example: Load the bang into the hole.

definitions.definition: An injection, a shot (of a narcotic drug).

definitions.example: There was a bang of onions off his breath.

definitions.definition: To make sudden loud noises, and often repeatedly, especially by exploding or hitting something.
definitions.example: My head was banging after drinking all night at the concert.
David and Mary banged into each other.
We can hear the couple banging upstairs.

definitions.definition: (with "in") To hammer or to hit anything hard.
definitions.example: Hold the picture while I bang in this nail.

definitions.definition: To cut squarely across, as the tail of a horse, or a person's forelock; to cut (the hair).

definitions.example: Do you smoke meth? No, I bang it.
The passenger door was bang against the garage wall.
Distracted, he ran bang into the opening door.

definitions.definition: A sudden percussive sound, such as made by the firing of a gun, slamming of a door, etc.
definitions.example: He pointed his finger at her like a gun and said, "Bang!"

definitions.definition: A hairstyle including such hair, especially cut straight across the forehead.
Cannabis, especially as used in the Indian subcontinent.
